title: FTX founder Sam Bankman -Fried's net worth dropped from almost $16 billion to zero; FTX filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Friday, and Bloomberg estimates the crypto exchange's former CEO lost his entire fortune
text:
Bankman-Fried, a 30-year-old graduate from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology , amassed his fortune of billions quickly within just five years in crypto, through Alameda and FTX. He has been referred by some industry participants as the crypto version of J.P. Morgan JPM after his companies offered lines of credit or equity to some struggling firms like BlockFi and Voyager at various times this year.

See also: 'I f—d up': Sam Bankman-Fried takes blame for liquidity issues at FTX

Of Bankman-Fried's one-time $15.6 billion in wealth, $6.22 billion came from FTX, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. And his stake in Alameda was valued at around $7.4 billion.

Bankman-Fried had about $1.99 billion of his wealth tied to FTX's U.S. arm, as well. He was also one of the biggest stakeholders in financial services company Robinhood Markets Inc. HOOD, accounting for more than $677 million of his net worth. But his shares were held by Alameda, according to Reuters , and have since been removed from his net worth calculation.

At his peak Bankman-Fried had a fortune worth at least $26 billion.

Read more: The $26 billion rise and fall of FTX crypto king Sam Bankman-Fried

All other FTX investors, including Softbank Vision Fund and Temasek , among others, could also see their investments in the company wiped out by the bankruptcy filing.

The FTX founder wrote in a viral Twitter thread on Friday he was " shocked to see things unravel the way they did ."

FTX's liquidity problems stemmed from its connection with Alameda, and Bankman-Fried's stake in the latter might be worthless as well, Bloomberg noted.

Earlier this week, rival exchange Binance was interested in a takeover of FTX, and said it had hoped to "support FTX's customers to provide liquidity." But the company later said it discovered issues that were "beyond our control or ability to help."

Representatives from Binance and FTX declined to comment on this story.

See: Despite $11 million in donations from FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried, Carrick Flynn loses big in Oregon primary

FTX's native token FTT went down about 88.8% over the past seven days to around $2.74, according to CoinMarketCap data .

Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao — a Chinese-Canadian executive commonly identified as "CZ" — founded the crypto exchange in 2017. The company has grown into the world's largest crypto exchange by 24-hour trading volume, compared with FTX, which ranks third, according to CoinMarketCap.

See also: Matt Damon's 'Fortune Favors the Brave' commercial is now one years old. Here's how much you would've lost if you bought crypto then.

The news around FTX comes amid a prolonged crypto winter. Bitcoin BTCUSD prices briefly dropped its lowest level in two years this week, and the price for ether ETHUSD is down 72.99% over the last year.

FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's net worth dropped from almost $16 billion to zero
